intro: Psychotria asae, commonly known as the "Amazonian Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria asae is also noted for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids.
